meanings.definition: A person who proclaims the gospel.
meanings.sent1: The gospellers spoke about the teachings of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: The gospellers shared the good news of Jesus with the community.
meanings.sent3: The gospellers told stories from the Bible in a joyful way.
meanings.sent4: Their voices echoed like gospellers spreading light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The gospellers' words were like music, touching the hearts of all who listened.

meanings.definition: Those who spread the teachings of the gospel.
meanings.sent1: In the town square, the gospellers shared the message of love and hope.
meanings.sent2: The gospellers traveled far and wide to bring the gospel to all.
meanings.sent3: The gospellers' enthusiasm for spreading the gospel was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Their words flew like birds, carrying the gospel message to every corner.
meanings.sent5: The gospellers were like seeds, planting faith wherever they went.

meanings.definition: One who evangelizes or preaches the gospel.
meanings.sent1: The gospellers preached about forgiveness and redemption.
meanings.sent2: People gathered to hear the gospellers speak of salvation.
meanings.sent3: The gospellers' passion for sharing the gospel was evident in their words.
meanings.sent4: Their voices rang out like bells, calling all to listen to the gospel.
meanings.sent5: The gospellers' mission was clear: to spread the gospel to all who would listen.
